Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure hoplites (part of hand holding round shield with studded rim remaining of first figure, to right, with added red on interior of shield); behind and to right, whirligig pattern with red on alternating crescents from second round shield of hoplite presumably attacking to left..
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
the painter appears to have had some difficulty creating the whirligig pattern as the individual crescents do not appear evenly. For other similar motifs, see Berlin F1147 from Caere.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.175) (phase 3)
